snippet: Australia and Malaysia pledged to press on as 10 planes and 11 ships scoured the latest search area, roughly the size of Poland.
abstract: Australia and Malaysia lead an intensified multinational search for the remains of Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 in the southern Indian Ocean; searchers prepare to deploy an underwater device to detect pings from the aircraft's flight data recorders, only days before their batteries are expected to die.

byline.original: By KIRK SEMPLE and MICHELLE INNIS
byline.contributor: Kirk Semple reported from Kuala Lumpur, and Michelle Innis from Sydney, Australia.

lead_paragraph: Australia and Malaysia pledged to press on as 10 planes and 11 ships scoured the latest search area, roughly the size of Poland.

headline.main: Search for Jet Intensifies as Odds Grow Longer
headline.print_headline: Search for Jet Intensifies as Odds Grow Longer
